thread.title: Boostio the latest to depart 100 Thieves in offseason of goodbyes
thread.title_full: Boostio the latest to depart 100 Thieves in offseason of goodbyes

author: Jenopelle
title: Boostio the latest to depart 100 Thieves in offseason of goodbyes
text:
Author's note: On October 21, 100 Thieves announced the departures of Zikz and Kess. Boostio was released on October 22. This story has been republished to reflect those announcements.
With its offseason underway, seven
100 Thieves
100 Thieves
North America
Rank #10
players and coaches have announced the upcoming expiry of their contracts with the organization, as well as the start of their restricted free agency.
Of the announcements, Peter "Asuna"
Mazuryk's may mark the beginning of the end for one of professional Valorant's longest-running loyalties. For all intents and purposes, Asuna has been a one-club man, joining from
Immortals
Immortals
Inactive
in late 2020 and suiting up for 100T ever since. While he's mostly been the team's Duelist player over those five years, he's also played the Initiator role on occasion, namely KAY/O, Gekko, and Skye over the years. Asuna shared that while he is still hoping to maintain his position on the team, he has been allowed to explore his options for the 2026 VCT season. He also said that he is open to playing any role except for scan initiators and as a team's in-game leader.
The second-longest tenured player on the squad was Matthew "Cryocells"
Panganiban, who also announced that he was LFT. Cryo had been with 100 Thieves since late 2022, joining ahead of the inaugural season of franchising in VCT. Throughout the years, he has taken on the team's Duelist duties alongside Asuna, as well as filled the team's secondary Controller role. He joined from
XSET
XSET
Inactive
, reaching the international stage alongside players like
zekken
,
dephh
, and
BcJ
. Cryo has crossed paths as a teammate of several current VCT pros throughout his career, also playing with
johnqt
on
SoaR
SoaR
Inactive
epathy
Ngawang Chonjor
fiziq
Lucas Blow
v1c
Victor Truong
Trill
Ashley Powell
and
koalanoob
on
Big Frames
Big Frames
Inactive
In0X
Theodor Bjornsson
Cryocells
Matthew Panganiban
svL
Sam Laudando
. He said that he is most comfortable in the Duelist role, but is also comfortable as a Controller or Sentinel.
Kelden "Boostio"
Pupello, who has been on 100T's inactive roster since the start of Americas Stage 2, also announced that he is still contracted to the end of the year, but has been allowed to explore his options. He shared, "I miss competing and playing in front of you guys. I really want to get back to the top and win another championship to prove I'm not a PIG." The former IGL, who helped 100T lift the Americas Stage 1 trophy in 2024, joined in the offseason prior off the heels of a Champions-winning campaign as the IGL of
Evil Geniuses
Evil Geniuses
North America
Rank #18
NaturE
Nicholas Garrison
supamen
Phat Le
yay
Jaccob Whiteaker
.
Drew "Kess"
Lee joined shortly after Boostio's benching was announced, and joined as the team's go-to Sentinel player while also flexing onto the secondary Controller and Initiator roles on occasion. He joined from North American Challengers squad
QoR
QoR
North America
Rank #7
nerve
Michael Yerrow
Logan
Logan Coffey
alym
toozy
Anthony De Leon
Dark3st
, but boasts a long list of VCL teams he played for before that. He had been in the scene since 2021, having played for
Heathens
Heathens
Inactive
Bacchus
sylph
ser1ez
Kess
Drew Lee
ThisKetchupSpicy
,
Zer0 Latency
Zer0 Latency
North America
Rank #237
,
LG Orange
LG Orange
North America
Rank #29
PepegaPig
mateo
KIMCHI
1papaya
Philip Ng
, and
Nightblood Gaming
Nightblood Gaming
North America
Rank #16
ScrewFace
Kyle Jensen
Notexxd
Jaden Anderson
sonofcar
kumi
smiley
Steven Fisher
. Once an Initiator player, Kess shared in his announcement that he is open to playing all roles except Duelist.
Alexander "zander"
Dituri joined 100T last offseason from
M80
M80
Inactive
, looking to replace
bang
, who departed for
Sentinels
Sentinels
North America
Rank #5
N4RRATE
Marshall Massey
Zellsis
Jordan Montemurro
zekken
Zachary Patrone
johnqt
Mohamed Amine Ouarid
. The Canadian joined after two years with M80, which saw back-to-back defeats in Americas Ascension grand finals, before finally landing with a VCT squad. He was the team's primary smokes player throughout the year, but after Boostio's benching, he was thrust into the IGL role. zander led 100T to a 3-2 finish in the group stage, but the team fell just three games into the playoffs, finishing 5th-6th in the region. He shared that 100T is evaluating a "full rebuild" and that he is looking to play the Controller or Sentinel roles for a new team, and that he is comfortable as an IGL.
Head coach Anthony "Zikz"
Gray also shared that he is seeking positions as a head coach, general manager, or director of esports. He joined 100T ahead of the 2024 season alongside Boostio, spending time as EG's assistant coach during the Champions-winning run. The 2023 season was Zikz's first and only with EG, as he joined from spending time with
NRG
NRG
North America
Rank #1
brawk
Brock Somerhalder
mada
Adam Pampuch
skuba
Logan Jenkins
Ethan
Ethan Arnold
in 2022. The former League of Legends coach, who also coached 100T's LoL squad from 2019 to 2021, is not the only member of the 100T coaching staff entering restricted free agency.
Assistant coach Yura "frenya"
Elkin, who joined ahead of the 2025 season after a long spell in Europe, also announced the end of his 100T contract. With experience both as a head coach and coach in EMEA Challengers circuits and Game Changers squads, frenya shared that he is seeking coaching opportunities at the VCT and VCL levels.
With seven members of the organization — five players and two coaches — announcing their restricted free agency,
100 Thieves
100 Thieves
North America
Rank #10
' full roster is now:
